## Hand Levels After Using Venus
Three of a Kind: Level 3, Base Chips 70, Base Mult 7

Wait, Venus was supposed to level up Three of a Kind by +2 Mult and +20 chips. Three of a Kind was at Level 2 (50 chips, 5 mult). After using Venus which levels it up once, it should be at Level 3 with 70 chips and 7 mult. That checks out - it went from Level 2 to Level 3.

But wait, Venus description says "( lvl.2 ) Level up Three of a Kind +2 Mult and +20 chips". This is a planet card, and the lvl.2 means it's a level 2 planet card. 

So it should level up Three of a Kind twice (once per level of the planet card). Looking at the progression:
- Level 1: 30 chips, 3 mult
- Level 2: 50 chips, 5 mult (+20 chips, +2 mult)
- Level 3: 70 chips, 7 mult (+20 chips, +2 mult)
- Level 4: 90 chips, 9 mult (+20 chips, +2 mult)

So Venus at level 2 should level up Three of a Kind twice, taking it from Level 2 to Level 4 (90 chips, 9 mult). But I only see it at Level 3. This means Venus only leveled it up once, not twice. Either the planet card mechanic works differently than I thought, or there's something else going on here.

Actually, rereading Venus's description: "( lvl.2 ) Level up Three of a Kind +2 Mult and +20 chips" - this probably means using the level 2 planet card triggers one level-up with those specific stat gains, not two separate level-ups. Three of a Kind is now at Level 3 (70 chips, 7 mult), and Constellation has reached X1.2 Mult. With $4 available, I can purchase The Hanged Man for $3, which destroys up to 2 cards.

However, since the Boss Blind has 7 face-down cards, I won't see most of my deck anyway, making card removal less valuable. Alternatively, the Arcana Pack for $4 could grant a powerful Tarot card like Justice or Strength immediately. I could also save the money and enter the Boss Blind with $4 plus interest. The blind requires 1600 chips with 7 hidden cards - a tough challenge. Playing Three of a Kind with three face cards would give me 70 chips and 7 mult as the base, plus additional chips from the cards themselves. upgrades (Strength) or other beneficial effects. Since I already have The Tower for creating Stone Cards with +50 chips, the Arcana Pack would give me additional tools to strengthen my hand further. This seems like the optimal choice for tackling this challenging Boss Blind.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
play_round - Play the current round.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
